oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Don Helms - 2006-11-11
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of musician Don Helms from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 11, 2006.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Don Helms; Bill Lloyd;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Contains audio from video and recorded audio excerpts. Includes questions from the audience. Recording begins in progress. Opening comments by host Bill Lloyd. Subjects include; Learning to play dobro -- Using a washtub to hear his steel guitar without electricity -- Meeting his wife Hazel -- Meeting Hank Williams -- Joining the military -- Getting the call from Hank Williams to come to Nashville -- Playing the Grand Ole Opry -- Life on the road with the Drifting Cowboys -- His first recording session with Hank -- Working with Ernest Tubb -- Hank's medical problems -- Recording Your Cheating Heart and the last time Don saw Hank -- Recording the song Mud Hut with the Drifting Cowboys and Chet Atkins -- Working with Ray Price and Ferlin Husky -- Playing of recording of hits medley -- Story about recording Walking After Midnight with Patsy Cline and working with Brenda Lee -- Surefire Music Publishing and Loretta Lynn -- Don's songwriting career highlights --

Story about Hank Williams song writing -- Performances with Dan Furmanik include; I Can't Help It (If I'm Still In Love With You) -- Your Cheatin' Heart -- Story about Hank writing songs and the writing of Mansion On The Hill -- Performs Mansion On The Hill -- Meeting Bob Dylan through Marty Stuart -- Performs Cold, Cold Heart -- Talks about his career after his stroke -- Audio from video of I Dreamed About Mama Last Night -- closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Helms, Don (Guitarist); Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
